duties_responsibilities.duty: Manufacturing and packaging of medical device instruments and components while maintaining product quality and optimal product flow.
Sorting, basic plastic assembly, tapering/dressing, labeling, wire wrapping, wire cutting, splitting, stripping, swaging, welding, winging, looping, complex assemblies, grinding, and polishing.
Following written procedures and verbal instruction for the assigned production operations required in the manufacturing and packaging of medical devices.
Inspecting work to ensure parts comply with specifications using basic hand tools and measuring/test equipment.
Documenting work which may require basic math, attention to detail, and accuracy in information being recorded.
Participating in cross-training programs as required by Team Captain/Coordinator.
Upholding established lean manufacturing principles and tools used on the production floor.
Adhering to the established Quality System Policies and procedures as instructed in the training process.
Following Good Manufacturing and Documentation practices (GMP, GDP).
Following all safety protocols, housekeeping, utilizing appropriate safety equipment and PPE. Reporting safety issues and improvements proactively to Team Captain or direct supervisor.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or GED required
